1.brief: a pasture (i.e. open field, whither cattle are driven); by implication, a desert; also speech (including its organs)
properly, to spin round (under the influence of any violent emotion), i.e. usually rejoice, or (as cringing) fear
a desert; especially (with the article prefix) the (generally) sterile valley of the Jordan and its continuation to the Red Sea
to break forth as a bud, i.e. bloom; generally, to spread; specifically, to fly (as extending the wings); figuratively, to flourish

2.brief: to break forth as a bud, i.e. bloom; generally, to spread; specifically, to fly (as extending the wings); figuratively, to flourish
to break forth as a bud, i.e. bloom; generally, to spread; specifically, to fly (as extending the wings); figuratively, to flourish
properly, to spin round (under the influence of any violent emotion), i.e. usually rejoice, or (as cringing) fear
meaning accession (used as an adverb or conjunction); also or yea; adversatively though
properly, to creak (or emit a stridulous sound), i.e. to shout (usually for joy)
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
Lebanon, a mountain range in Palestine
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
Karmel, the name of a hill and of a town in Palestine
plain, Sharon, the name of a place in Palestine
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

3.brief: to fasten upon; hence, to seize, be strong (figuratively, courageous, causatively strengthen, cure, help, repair, fortify), obstinate; to bind, restrain, conquer
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
to totter or waver (through weakness of the legs, especially the ankle); by implication, to falter, stumble, faint or fall
to be alert, physically (on foot) or mentally (in courage)

4.brief: properly, to be liquid or flow easily, i.e. (by implication); to hurry (in a good or a bad sense); often used (with another verb) adverbially, promptly
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
to fasten upon; hence, to seize, be strong (figuratively, courageous, causatively strengthen, cure, help, repair, fortify), obstinate; to bind, restrain, conquer
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

treatment, i.e. an act (of good or ill); by implication, service or requital

to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor

to open (the senses, especially the eyes); figuratively, to be observant
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)
to open wide (literally or figuratively); specifically, to loosen, begin, plough, carve

properly, to creak (or emit a stridulous sound), i.e. to shout (usually for joy)
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)

to cleave; generally, to rend, break, rip or open
a pasture (i.e. open field, whither cattle are driven); by implication, a desert; also speech (including its organs)
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
a stream, especially a winter torrent; (by implication) a (narrow) valley (in which a brook runs); also a shaft (of a mine)
a desert; especially (with the article prefix) the (generally) sterile valley of the Jordan and its continuation to the Red Sea

quivering glow (of the air), expectation. the mirage
a marsh; hence a rush (as growing in swamps); hence a stockade of reeds
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen

a marine or land monster, i.e. sea-serpent or jackal
a couch or place of repose
a reed (as erect); by resemblance a rod (especially for measuring), shaft, tube, stem, the radius (of the arm), beam (of a steelyard)
properly, an absorbent, i.e. the bulrush (from its porosity); specifically the papyrus

there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence

a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence

to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again

Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
properly, a creaking (or shrill sound), i.e. shout (of joy or grief)

above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
to flit, i.e. vanish away (subside, escape; causatively, chase, impel, deliver)
